messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Digest Number 390
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/3/02 10:42:03 PM Central Daylight Time, AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/3/02 10:42:03 PM Central Daylight Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< When asked why she
did it, she replied, "because I never had before". : ) >>

As a former mountain climber I remember quoting "because it's there" when
asked why we climbed mountains.
Some famous mountain climber (I believe it was Hillary) used to say it and
many climbers use it now.
Another thing was "do you climb to get to the top, or do you get to the top
to climb?", the answer would depend on how tired I was, and how far from the
top!! LOL
I already like your Grandma, what a cool lady.
Ren

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Digest Number 390
messages.msgSnippet: ... Because it got your address from the original and just replied.  I got one from a friend once that had the subject Guess what we got?  A TILLER!  lol.
messages.messageBody:
>
>
>
>Tia, can I ask a question since you know more about it than I do? If it was
>an unintentional result of another virus victim, why would it come as a
>direct result of a post I made. Why did it come "re: alwaylearning}
>Philosophy"?
>

Because it got your address from the original and just replied. I got
one from a friend once that had the subject "Guess what we got? A
TILLER!" lol. So, I opened the email (not the attachment, though).

All of the people I know who got a virus and sent it on never knew it
until I emailed them back.

Tuck
